00003 /**
00004  * @brief Validator class.
00005  * 
00006  * This class is used to validate data.
00007  * 
00008  * Boo validation functions ignore leading and trailing whitespace.
00009  * For example Boo_Validator::isInt("   16   ") will return TRUE.
00010  * 
00011  * @class       Boo_Validator
00012  * @license     http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.txt GNU General Public License
00013  * @link        http://code.ramaboo.com/ Boo Framework
00014  * @copyright   2008 David Singer
00015  * @author      David Singer <david@ramaboo.com>
00016  * @version     2.0.0
00017  */

00408     /**
00409      * @brief Validates a value.
00410      * 
00411      * Use # (pound sign) in the validation rule to represent the value.
00412      * 
00413      * You should only use this function if you need to store a validation rule as a string of text 
00414      * such as in an xml file for use with Boo_Form. Calling member functions directly is much more efficient.
00415      * 
00416      * @param string $value The value to validate.
00417      * @param string $validationRule The validation code (must be valid PHP).
00418      * @param bool $required[optional] Value is required (not null).
00419      * @return bool Returns TRUE if validation was successful, FALSE otherwise.
00420      * 
00421      * @code
00422      * Boo_Validator::validate(5, "Boo_Validator::isInt(#, 3, 8);", true);
00423      * // returns TRUE
00424      * @endcode
00425      */
00426     
00427     /**
00428      * @brief Gets the yes or no array.
00429      * @return array Returns yes or no array. The key is the integer, value is the word.
00430      */
00431     public static function getYesNo() {
00432         return self::$yesNo;
00433     }

00447     public static function getTrueFalse() {
00448         return self::$trueFalse;

00450     
00451     public static function validate($value, $validationRule, $required = true) {
00452         $value = trim($value);
00453         $value = quote(addslashes($value));
00454         
00455         // make dollar sign safe
00456         $value = str_replace('$', '\$', $value);
00457         
00458         $validationRule = trim($validationRule);
00459         // add ending semicolon if needed
00460         if (substr($validationRule, -1) != ';') {
00461             $validationRule .= ';';
00462         }
00463         $validationRule = str_replace('#', $value, $validationRule);
00464         
00465         //echo "Validation Rule: {$validationRule}<br /><br />"; // useful for debugging
00466         
00467         $result = eval("return $validationRule");
00468         
00469         // special case for allowing null values
00470         if (!$required && $value == "\"\"") { // double quotes because of call to quote()
00471             $result = true;
00472         }
00473         
00474         return $result;
00475     }
00476     
00477     /**
00478      * @brief Determins if a value is a string or not.
00479      * 
00480      * @param string $string The value to test.
00481      * @param integer $min[optional] The minimum length of the string.
00482      * @param integer $max[optional] The maximum length of the string.
00483      * @return bool Returns TRUE if it is a string, FALSE otherwise.
00484      */
00485     public static function isString($string, $min = false, $max = false) {
00486         $string = trim($string);
00487         $result = false;
00488         if (strlen($string) > 0) {
00489             $result = true;
00490             if ($min !== false) {
00491                 $result = $result && (strlen($string) >= $min);
00492             }
00493             if ($max !== false) {
00494                 $result = $result && (strlen($string) <= $max);
00495             }
00496         }
00497         return $result;
00498     }
00499     
00500     /**
00501      * @brief Determins if a value is alphabetic.
00502      * 
00503      * Alphabetic is defined as [A-Za-z].
00504      * 
00505      * @param string $string The value to test.
00506      * @param integer $min[optional] The minimum length of the string.
00507      * @param integer $max[optional] The maximum length of the string.
00508      * @return bool Returns TRUE if value is alphabetic, FALSE otherwise.
00509      * @see http://us3.php.net/manual/en/function.ctype-alpha.php
00510      */
00511     public static function isAlpha($string, $min = false, $max = false) {
00512         $string = trim($string);
00513         $result = false;
00514         if (ctype_alpha($string)) {
00515             $result = true;
00516             if ($min !== false) {
00517                 $result = $result && (strlen($string) >= $min);
00518             }
00519             if ($max !== false) {
00520                 $result = $result && (strlen($string) <= $max);
00521             }
00522         }
00523         return $result;
00524     }
00525     
00526     /**
00527      * @brief Determins if a value is alphanumeric.
00528      * 
00529      * Alphanumeric is defined as [A-Za-z0-9].
00530      * 
00531      * @param string $string The value to test.
00532      * @param integer $min[optional] The minimum length of the string.
00533      * @param integer $max[optional] The maximum length of the string.
00534      * @return bool Returns TRUE if value is alphanumeric, FALSE otherwise.
00535      * @see http://us3.php.net/manual/en/function.ctype-alnum.php
00536      */
00537     public static function isAlphaNum($string, $min = false, $max = false) {
00538         $string = trim($string);
00539         $result = false;
00540         if (ctype_alnum($string)) {
00541             $result = true;
00542             if ($min !== false) {
00543                 $result = $result && (strlen($string) >= $min);
00544             }
00545             if ($max !== false) {
00546                 $result = $result && (strlen($string) <= $max);
00547             }
00548         }
00549         return $result;
00550     }
00551     
00552     /**
00553      * @brief Determins if a value is alphanumeric plus the undersocre.
00554      * 
00555      * Alphanumeric is defined as [A-Za-z0-9_].
00556      * 
00557      * @param string $string The value to test.
00558      * @param integer $min[optional] The minimum length of the string.
00559      * @param integer $max[optional] The maximum length of the string.
00560      * @param bool $firstChar[optional] If TRUE the first character must be a letter.
00561      * @return bool Returns TRUE if value is alphanumeric, FALSE otherwise.
00562      */
00563     public static function isAlphaNumPlus($string, $min = false, $max = false, $firstChar = false) {
00564         $string = trim($string);
00565         $result = false;
00566         if (preg_match('/^[A-Za-z0-9_]*$/', $string)) {
00567             $result = true;
00568             if ($min !== false) {
00569                 $result = $result && (strlen($string) >= $min);
00570             }
00571             if ($max !== false) {
00572                 $result = $result && (strlen($string) <= $max);
00573             }
00574             
00575             if ($firstChar) {
00576                 // first character must be letter
00577                 $result = $result && self::isAlpha(substr($string, 0 , 1));
00578             }
00579         }
00580         return $result;
00581     }
00582     
00583     /**
00584      * @brief Determins if a value is alphanumeric plus some common characters.
00585      * 
00586      * Alphanumeric is defined as [A-Za-z0-9_-.()].
00587      * 
00588      * @param string $string The value to test.
00589      * @param integer $min[optional] The minimum length of the string.
00590      * @param integer $max[optional] The maximum length of the string.
00591      * @param bool $firstChar[optional] If TRUE the first character must be a letter.
00592      * @return bool Returns TRUE if value is alphanumeric, FALSE otherwise.
00593      * @todo Maybe add more characters.
00594      */
00595     public static function isAlphaNumExtended($string, $min = false, $max = false, $firstChar = false) {
00596         $string = trim($string);
00597         $result = false;
00598         if (preg_match('/^[A-Za-z0-9_\-\.\(\)]*$/', $string)) {
00599             $result = true;
00600             if ($min !== false) {
00601                 $result = $result && (strlen($string) >= $min);
00602             }
00603             if ($max !== false) {
00604                 $result = $result && (strlen($string) <= $max);
00605             }
00606             
00607             if ($firstChar) {
00608                 // first character must be letter
00609                 $result = $result && self::isAlpha(substr($string, 0 , 1));
00610             }
00611         }
00612         return $result;
00613     }
00614     
00615     /**
00616      * @brief Determins if string contains only ASCII printable characters.
00617      * 
00618      * @see Boo_Charset::getPrintable().
00619      * 
00620      * @param string $string The string to test.
00621      * @param integer $min[optional] The minimum length of the string.
00622      * @param integer $max[optional] The maximum length of the string.
00623      * @return bool Returns TRUE if string contains only ASCII printable characters, FALSE otherwise.
00624      */
00625     public static function isPrintable($string, $min = false, $max = false) {
00626         $string = trim($string);
00627         $result = true;
00628         foreach (str_split($string) as $value) {
00629             if (strpos(Boo_Charset::getPrintable(), $value) === false) {
00630                 $result = false;
00631                 break;
00632             }
00633         }
00634         
00635         if ($min !== false) {
00636             $result = $result && (strlen($string) >= $min);
00637         }
00638         if ($max !== false) {
00639             $result = $result && (strlen($string) <= $max);
00640         }
00641         
00642         return $result;
00643     }
00644     
00645     /**
00646      * @brief Determins if string contains only hexadecimal characters.
00647      * 
00648      * @see Boo_Charset::getHex().
00649      * 
00650      * @param string $string The string to test.
00651      * @param integer $min[optional] The minimum length of the string.
00652      * @param integer $max[optional] The maximum length of the string.
00653      * @return bool Returns TRUE if string contains only hexadecimal characters, FALSE otherwise.
00654      */
00655     public static function isHex($string, $min = false, $max = false) {
00656         $string = strtolower(trim($string));
00657         $result = true;
00658         
00659         if (preg_match('/^[a-f0-9]*$/', $string)) {
00660             $result = true;
00661         } else {
00662             $result = false;
00663         }
00664         
00665         if ($min !== false) {
00666             $result = $result && (strlen($string) >= $min);
00667         }
00668         if ($max !== false) {
00669             $result = $result && (strlen($string) <= $max);
00670         }
00671         
00672         return $result;
00673     }
00674     
00675     /**
00676      * @brief Determins if string is a Social Security number.
00677      * 
00678      * Social Security number can be in any format. Use Boo_Format::formatSocialSecurityNumber() if you 
00679      * want the data properly formated.
00680      * 
00681      * @warning This function is only a rough validator as it does not check for reserved numbers such as 666-xx-xxxx or xxx-xx-0000, etc.
00682      * 
00683      * @return bool Returns TRUE if string is a Socical Security number, FALSE otherwise.
00684      * @param string $ssNumber The string to test.
00685      * @see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Social_security_number
00686      */
00687     public static function isSocialSecurityNumber($ssNumber) {
00688         $ssNumber = trim($ssNumber);
00689         $ssNumber = ereg_replace('[^0-9]+', '', $ssNumber);
00690         
00691         if ($ssNumber == '') {
00692             return false;
00693         }
00694         
00695         if (strlen($ssNumber) == 9) {
00696             return true;
00697         } else {
00698             return false;
00699         }
00700     }

00702     /**
00703      * @brief Determins if a string is numeric.
00704      * 
00705      * Preforms the same function as the built in PHP function \c is_numeric().
00706      * 
00707      * @param string $string The test string.
00708      * @param int $min Minimum value of the number.
00709      * @param int $max Maximum value of the number.
00710      * @return bool Returns TRUE on success, FALSE otherwise.
00711      * @see http://us3.php.net/manual/en/function.is-numeric.php
00712      */
00713     public static function isNumeric($string, $min = false, $max = false) {
00714         $string = trim($string);
00715         $result = false;
00716         if (is_numeric($string)) {
00717             $result = true;
00718             if ($min !== false) {
00719                 $result = $result && $string >= $min;
00720             }
00721             if ($max !== false) {
00722                 $result = $result && $string <= $max;
00723             }
00724         }
00725         return $result;
00726         
00727     }
00728     
00729     /**
00730      * @brief Determins if a string is a float.
00731      * 
00732      * @param string $string The test string.
00733      * @param int $min Minimum value of the number.
00734      * @param int $max Maximum value of the number.
00735      * @return bool Returns TRUE on success, FALSE otherwise.
00736      */
00737     public static function isFloat($string, $min = false, $max = false) {
00738         $string = trim($string);
00739         $result = false;
00740         if (preg_match('/^(\d?)+(\.\d*)?$/', $string)) {
00741             $result = true;
00742             if ($min !== false) {
00743                 $result = $result && $string >= $min;
00744             }
00745             if ($max !== false) {
00746                 $result = $result && $string <= $max;
00747             }
00748         }
00749         return $result;
00750         
00751     }
00752     
00753     /**
00754      * @brief Determins if a string is a price.
00755      * 
00756      * The maximum price is 16 characters or 14 with 2 decimal places.
00757      * This is the same as MySQL 5 datatype decimal(16,2).
00758      * 
00759      * @param string $string The test string.
00760      * @param int $min Minimum value of the number.
00761      * @param int $max Maximum value of the number.
00762      * @return bool Returns TRUE on success, FALSE otherwise.
00763      */
00764     public static function isPrice($string, $min = false, $max = false) {
00765         $string = trim($string);
00766         $result = false;
00767         
00768         // remove curancy symbol
00769         $string = Boo_Helper::removeCurrencySymbol($string);
00770         
00771         if (preg_match('/(^[0-9]{1,16}$)|(^[0-9]{1,14}[\.][0-9]{1,2}$)/', $string)) {
00772             $result = true;
00773             if ($min !== false) {
00774                 $result = $result && $string >= $min;
00775             }
00776             if ($max !== false) {
00777                 $result = $result && $string <= $max;
00778             }
00779         }
00780         
00781         return $result;
00782     }
00783     
00784     /**
00785      * @brief Determins if a string is an integer.
00786      * 
00787      * Preforms the same function as the built in PHP function \c ctype_digit()
00788      * except this will allow negative integers and does not require a string variable.
00789      * 
00790      * @param string $string The test string.
00791      * @param int $min Minimum value of the number.
00792      * @param int $max Maximum value of the number.
00793      * @return bool Returns TRUE on success, FALSE otherwise.
00794      * @see http://us3.php.net/manual/en/function.ctype-digit.php
00795      */
00796     public static function isInt($string, $min = false, $max = false) {
00797         $string = trim($string);
00798         $result = false;
00799         // is all numbers or is a negitve sign and all numbers
00800         if (ctype_digit($string) || (substr($string, 0, 1) == '-' && ctype_digit(substr($string, 1)))) {
00801             $result = true;
00802             if ($min !== false) {
00803                 $result = $result && $string >= $min;
00804             }
00805             if ($max !== false) {
00806                 $result = $result && $string <= $max;
00807             }
00808         }
00809         return $result;
00810     }
00811     
00812     public static function isBooId($id) {
00813         $id = trim($id);
00814         $result = false;
00815         if (ctype_digit($id) && $id <= PHP_INT_MAX) {
00816             $result = true;
00817         }
00818         
00819         return $result;
00820     }

00824         $date = trim($date);
00825         return preg_match(BOO_REGEX_DATE, $date);
00826     }

00828     /**
00829      * @brief Determins if a string is a date of a given format.
00830      * 
00831      * This only supports time formats supported by the PHP \c date() function and \c strtotime().
00832      * 
00833      * @param string $date The date to test.
00834      * @param mixed $format The date format. Accepts a single format as a string or an array of formats.
00835      * @return bool Returns TRUE on success, FALSE otherwise.
00836      * @todo Test function.
00837      */
00838     public static function isDateFormat($date, $format) {
00839         $date = trim($date);
00840         $timestamp = strtotime($date);
00841         
00842         $result = false;
00843         $formats = array();
00844         if (is_string($format)) {
00845             $formats[] = $format;
00846         } // else its an array
00847         
00848         foreach ($formats as $key => $value) {
00849             $phpDate = date($value, $timestamp);
00850             if ($date == $phpDate) {
00851                 $result = true;
00852                 break;
00853             }
00854         }
00855         
00856         return $result;
00857     }

00891                 return true;

01012      */
01013     public static function isUri($uri) {
01014         $uri = trim($url);
01015         return preg_match(BOO_REGEX_URI, $uri) && (strlen($uri) < 256);
01016     }

01037     
01038     /**
01039      * @brief Determins if a phone number is valid.
01040      * @return bool Returns TRUE if phone number is valid, FALSE otherwise.
01041      * @param string $phoneNumber The phone number to test.
01042      */
01043     public static function isPhoneNumber($phoneNumber) {
01044         $phoneNumber = preg_replace('/[^0-9]/', '', $phoneNumber);
01045         
01046         if ($phoneNumber == null) {
01047             return false;
01048         }
01049         
01050         if (strlen($phoneNumber) == 11 && substr($phoneNumber, 0, 1) == 1) {
01051             // remove leading 1 from phone number
01052             $phoneNumber = substr($phoneNumber, 1);
01053         }
01054         
01055         if (strlen($phoneNumber) == 10) {
01056             return true;
01057         } else {
01058             return false;
01059         }
01060     }
01061     
01062     /**
01063      * @brief Determins if a phone extension is valid.
01064      * 
01065      * Valid formats are:
01066      * \li x123456
01067      * \li 123456
01068      * 
01069      * Where 123456 can be any number from 1 to 999999.
01070      * 
01071      * @return bool Returns TRUE if extension is valid, FALSE otherwise.
01072      * @param string $phoneExt The phone extension to test.
01073      */
01074     public static function isPhoneExtension($phoneExt) {
01075         $phoneExt = trim($phoneExt);
01076         
01077         if ($phoneExt == null) {
01078             return false;
01079         }
01080         
01081         if(strtolower(substr($phoneExt, 0, 1)) == 'x') {
01082             // remove leading x from phone extension
01083             $phoneExt = substr($phoneExt, 1);
01084         }
01085         
01086         if (self::isInt($phoneExt, 1, 999999)) {
01087             return true;
01088         } else {
01089             return false;
01090         }
01091         
01092     }
01093     
01094     /**
01095      * @brief Determins if a credit card number is masked.
01096      * 
01097      * Checks if the first 4 digits of the card number are ****. This function is used to check
01098      * account information after a user has submited updates. If the card number is masked
01099      * then they have likely not updated it and it can be ignored (not saved). This is just a quick check and should only
01100      * be used to determin if a card number should be saved or not. It does not check against manipulation of the 
01101      * card number itself.
01102      * 
01103      * @warning This function does not check the validity of the masked credit card number
01104      * 
01105      * @return bool Returns TRUE if credit card number is masked, FALSE otherwise.
01106      * @param object $cardNumber
01107      */
01108     public static function isCardNumberMasked($cardNumber) {
01109         $cardNumber = trim($cardNumber);
01110         
01111         if (preg_match('/^[\*]+[0-9]{4}$/', $cardNumber)) {
01112             return true;
01113         } else {
01114             return false;
01115         }
01116         
01117     }
01118     
01119     /**
01120      * @brief Determins if a credit card number is valid.
01121      * 
01122      * @warning Uses the Luhn algorithm to check for validity. This may not work correctly for more obsucre credit cards.
01123      * 
01124      * @see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luhn_algorithm
01125      * @return bool Returns TRUE if card number is valid, FALSE otherwise.
01126      * @param string $cardNumber The card number to test.
01127      */
01128     public static function isCardNumber($cardNumber) {
01129         $cardNumber = ereg_replace('[^0-9]+', '', $cardNumber);
01130         
01131         if (!$cardNumber || strlen($cardNumber) < 13) {
01132             // card number is null or to short
01133             return false;
01134         }
01135         
01136         $numberLength = strlen($cardNumber);
01137         $parity = $numberLength % 2;
01138         
01139         $total = 0;
01140         for ($i = 0; $i < $numberLength; $i++) {
01141             $digit = $cardNumber[$i];
01142             if ($i % 2 == $parity) {
01143                 $digit *= 2;
01144                 if ($digit > 9) {
01145                     $digit -= 9;
01146                 }
01147             }
01148             $total += $digit;
01149         }
01150         
01151         if ($total % 10 == 0) {
01152             return true;
01153         } else {
01154             return false;
01155         }
01156     }
01157 
01158     /**
01159      * @brief Determins if an expiration date is valid.
01160      * 
01161      * Expiration date can be in the following formats:
01162      * \li MMYY
01163      * \li MM/YY
01164      * \li MM-YY
01165      * \li MMYYYY
01166      * \li MM/YYYY
01167      * \li MM-YYYY
01168      * \li YYYY-MM-DD
01169      * \li YYYY/MM/DD
01170      * 
01171      * @see Boo_Format::formatExpDate
01172      * @param string $expDate The expiration date to test.
01173      * @return bool Returns TRUE if expiration date is valid, FALSE otherwise.
01174      */
01175     public static function isExpDate($expDate) {
01176         // remove non numbers
01177         $expDate = ereg_replace('[^0-9]+', '', $expDate);
01178         $length = strlen($expDate);
01179         
01180         $year = ''; $month = '';
01181         
01182         switch ($length) {
01183             
01184             case 4: // mmyy
01185                 $month = substr($expDate, 0, 2);
01186                 $year = substr($expDate, 2, 2);
01187                 break;
01188                 
01189             case 6: // mmyyyy
01190                 $month = substr($expDate, 0, 2);
01191                 $year = substr($expDate, 4, 2);
01192                 break;
01193                 
01194             case 8: // yyyymmdd
01195                 $month = substr($expDate, 4, 2);
01196                 $year = substr($expDate, 2, 2); 
01197                 break;
01198                 
01199             default:
01200                 return false;
01201         }
01202         
01203         // valid format
01204         // check for expiration
01205         // add a month to the expiration date
01206         $d = strtotime("$month/01/$year +1 month");
01207         if ($d > time()) {
01208             // in the future
01209             return true;
01210         } else {
01211             // in the past
01212             return false;
01213         }
01214     }
01215     
01216     /**
01217      * @brief Checks if string is safe to use in an SQL statement.
01218      * 
01219      * Safe characters are all letters, numbers, dash, and the underscore.
01220      * 
01221      * @param $string The string to test.
01222      * @param integer $min[optional] The minimum length of the name.
01223      * @param integer $max[optional] The maximum length of the name.
01224      * @return bool Returns TRUE if string is safe, FALSE otherwise.
01225      */
01226     public static function isSqlSafe($string, $min = false, $max = false) {
01227         $string = trim($string);
01228         $result = false;
01229 
01230         if (preg_match('/^[A-Za-z0-9-_\.]+$/', $string)) {
01231             $result = true;
01232             if ($min !== false) {
01233                 $result = $result && strlen($string) >= $min;
01234             }
01235             if ($max !== false) {
01236                 $result = $result && strlen($string) <= $max;
01237             }
01238         }
01239         
01240         return $result;
01241     }
01242     
01243     /**
01244      * @brief Determins if string is an SQL direction.
01245      * 
01246      * Used by the ORDER BY SQL statment.
01247      * Possible directions are:
01248      * \li ASC
01249      * \li DESC
01250      * 
01251      * @return bool Returns TRUE if string is an SQL direction, FALSE otherwise.
01252      * @param string $string The string to test.
01253      */
01254     public static function isSqlDirection($string) {
01255         $string = strtoupper(trim($string));
01256         return $string == 'ASC' || $string == 'DESC';
01257     }
01258     
01259     /**
01260      * @brief Validates a vehical identification number aginst the ISO 3779 standard.
01261      * 
01262      * 1M8GDM9AXKP042788 is a valid VIN (used for testing).
01263      * 
01264      * @see http://ramaboo.com/code/is_vin/
01265      * @see http://code.google.com/p/isvin/
01266      * @see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vehicle_identification_number
01267      * 
01268      * @param string $vin The vehical identification number.
01269      * 
01270      * @return bool Returns TRUE if the vehical identification number is valid, FALSE otherwise.
01271      * 
01272      * @license http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.txt GNU General Public License
01273      * @copyright 2008 David Singer
01274      * @author David Singer <david@ramaboo.com>
01275      * @version 1.1.3
01276      * 
01277      * @code
01278      * if (is_vin('1M8GDM9AXKP042788')) {
01279      *  echo 'valid';
01280      * } else {
01281      *  echo 'not valid';
01282      * }
01283      * @endcode
01284      * 
01285      * @todo Test and support ISO 3780.
01286      */
01287     public static function isVin($vin) {
01288         $vin = strtoupper(trim($vin));
01289         
01290         // check VIN length
01291         if (strlen($vin) != 17) {
01292             // error VIN is not 17 characters long
01293             return false;
01294         }
01295         
01296         // setup array of letter values
01297         $value['A'] = 1;
01298         $value['B'] = 2;
01299         $value['C'] = 3;
01300         $value['D'] = 4;
01301         $value['E'] = 5;
01302         $value['F'] = 6;
01303         $value['G'] = 7;
01304         $value['H'] = 8;
01305         $value['J'] = 1;
01306         $value['K'] = 2;
01307         $value['L'] = 3;
01308         $value['M'] = 4;
01309         $value['N'] = 5;
01310         $value['P'] = 7;
01311         $value['R'] = 9;
01312         $value['S'] = 2;
01313         $value['T'] = 3;
01314         $value['U'] = 4;
01315         $value['V'] = 5;
01316         $value['W'] = 6;
01317         $value['X'] = 7;
01318         $value['Y'] = 8;
01319         $value['Z'] = 9;
01320         
01321         // setup digit weights
01322         $weight[0] = 8; // 1st position
01323         $weight[1] = 7;
01324         $weight[2] = 6;
01325         $weight[3] = 5;
01326         $weight[4] = 4;
01327         $weight[5] = 3;
01328         $weight[6] = 2;
01329         $weight[7] = 10;
01330         $weight[8] = 0; // 9th position, this is the check digit
01331         $weight[9] = 9;
01332         $weight[10] = 8;
01333         $weight[11] = 7;
01334         $weight[12] = 6;
01335         $weight[13] = 5;
01336         $weight[14] = 4;
01337         $weight[15] = 3;
01338         $weight[16] = 2; // 17th position
01339         
01340         $char = str_split($vin); // split string into character array
01341         $total = 0;
01342         
01343         // loop though each character of the vin
01344         for ($i = 0; $i < 17; $i++) {
01345             if (is_numeric($char[$i])) {
01346                 // use number
01347                 // update total
01348                 $total = $total + ($char[$i] * $weight[$i]);
01349             } elseif (array_key_exists($char[$i], $value)) {
01350                 // use value of letter
01351                 // update total
01352                 $total = $total + ($value[$char[$i]] * $weight[$i]);
01353             } else {
01354                 // error illegal character used
01355                 return false;
01356             }
01357         }
01358         
01359         $mod = $total % 11; // find remainder after deviding by 11
01360         
01361         // if mod is 10 set the check_digit to X
01362         if ($mod == 10) {
01363             $checkDigit = 'X';
01364         } else {
01365             $checkDigit = $mod;
01366         }
01367         
01368         // check if the 9th character in the string (the check digit) equals the calculated value
01369         if ($char[8] == $checkDigit) { 
01370             // VIN is valid
01371             return true;
01372         } else {
01373             // VIN is not valid
01374             return false;
01375         }
01376     }

01379      * @brief Determines if a username is valid.
01380      * 
01381      * Provides API compatibility.
01382      * 
01383      * @param string $username The username.
01384      * @return bool Returns TRUE if username is valid, FALSE if already in use.
01385      */
01386     public static function isUsername($username) {
01387         return self::isAlphaNumPlus($username, Boo_User::MIN_USERNAME_LENGTH, Boo_User::MAX_USERNAME_LENGTH, true);
01388     }

01410     /**
01411      * @brief Determins if a value is odd.
01412      * 
01413      * @param mixed $value The value to test.
01414      * @return bool Returns TRUE if value is odd, FALSE otherwise.
01415      */
01416     public static function isOdd($value) {
01417         $value = (string) trim($value);
01418         return ctype_digit($value) & ($value & 1);
01419     }
01420     
01421     /**
01422      * @brief Determins if a value is even.
01423      * 
01424      * @param mixed $value The value to test.
01425      * @return bool Returns TRUE if value is even, FALSE otherwise.
01426      */
01427     public static function isEven($value) {
01428         $value = (string) trim($value);
01429         return ctype_digit($value) & (!($value & 1));
01430     }

01432     /**
01433      * @brief Determins if a value contains html.
01434      * 
01435      * @param mixed $string The string to test.
01436      * @return bool Returns TRUE if tags are found, FALSE if no tags are found.
01437      */
01438     public static function isHtml($string) {
01439         $string = trim($string);
01440         // check if value is the same after html is removed
01441         $result = (strlen($string) == strlen(strip_tags($string)));
01442         return !$result;
01443     }

01445     /**
01446      * @brief Determins if a value is null.
01447      * 
01448      * \b Important! This is not the same as is_null().
01449      * 
01450      * The following values are considered null:
01451      * \li A string with only spaces.
01452      * \li An empty string.
01453      * \li NULL.
01454      * \li FALSE.
01455      * \li An empty array.
01456      * 
01457      * @param mixed $string The string to test.
01458      * @return bool Returns TRUE if value is null, FALSE otherwise.
01459      * @todo Fix to test objects.
01460      */
01461     public static function isNull($string) {
01462         
01463         if (is_array($string)) {
01464             return empty($string);
01465         }
01466         
01467         if (is_object($string)) {
01468             // this could use some work
01469             return false;
01470         }
01471         
01472         $string = trim($string);
01473         return ($string == '') || ($string === null);
01474     }

01477      * @brief Determins if a password is valid.
01478      * 
01479      * @param string $password The password.
01480      * @return bool Returns TRUE if password is valid, FALSE otherwise.
01481      * @todo Add support for complex password testing.
01482      */
01483     public static function isPassword($password){
01484         return self::isString($password, 4, 32);
01485     }

01487     /**
01488      * @brief Determins if a required value is set.
01489      * 
01490      * @param mixed $value The value to test.
01491      * @return bool Returns TRUE if value is set, FALSE otherwise.
01492      */
01493     public static function isRequired($value) {
01494         $value = trim($value);
01495         return !self::isNull($value);
01496     }
01497     
01498     /**
01499      * @brief Determins if a value matchs the posted value with a given key.
01500      * 
01501      * @param string $value The value to test.
01502      * @param string $post The key for the \v $_POST array.
01503      * @return bool Returns TRUE if they match, FALSE otherwise.
01504      */
01505     public static function isPostMatch($value, $post) {
01506         $value = trim($value);
01507         $post = trim($post);
01508         
01509         if (!array_key_exists($post, $_POST)) {
01510             // not in $_POST
01511             return false;
01512         }
01513         
01514         if ($value == $_POST[$post]) {
01515             // values are the smae
01516             return true;
01517         } else {
01518             // not the same
01519             return false;
01520         }
01521     }

01528      * 
01529      * @param string $value
01530      * @return bool Returns TRUE if checkbox is checked, FALSE otherwise.
01531      */
01532     public static function isChecked($value) {
01533         return self::isRequired($value);
01534     }

01536     /**
01537      * @brief Determins if a file has been uploaded ok.
01538      * 
01539      * Will not cause error if nothing was uploaded.
01540      * 
01541      * @see Boo_Validator::isUploadRequired().
01542      * @param string $name The name of the file as an key in the \c $_FILES array.
01543      * @return bool Returns TRUE on success, FALSE otherwise.
01544      */
01545     public static function isUpload($name) {
01546         if (isset($_FILES[$name])) {
01547             if ($_FILES[$name]['error'] == UPLOAD_ERR_OK || $_FILES[$name]['error'] == UPLOAD_ERR_NO_FILE) {
01548                 return true;
01549             } else {
01550                 return false;
01551             }
01552         } else {
01553             return false;
01554         }
01555     }
01556

01558      * @brief Determins if a file has been uploaded ok.

01561      * @return bool Returns TRUE on success, FALSE otherwise.
01562      */
01563     public static function isUploadRequired($name) {
01564         if (isset($_FILES[$name])) {
01565             if ($_FILES[$name]['error'] == UPLOAD_ERR_OK) {
01566                 return true;
01567             } else {
01568                 return false;
01569             }
01570         } else {
01571             return false;
01572         }

01631     /**
01632      * @brief Determins if file extension is allowed on an uploaded file.
01633      * 
01634      * @param string $name The name of the file as an key in the \c $_FILES array.
01635      * @param array $extensions The array of allowed extensions.
01636      * @return bool Returns TRUE on success, FALSE otherwise.
01637      */
01638     public static function isUploadExtensionAllowed($name, $extensions) {
01639         if (isset($_FILES[$name])) {
01640             $filename = $_FILES[$name]['name'];
01641             
01642             if ($_FILES[$name]['error'] == UPLOAD_ERR_OK) {
01643                 $pathParts = pathinfo($filename);
01644                 return in_array($pathParts['extension'], $extensions);
01645             } else {
01646                 return true;
01647             }
01648         } else {
01649             return false;
01650         }
01651     }

01697     /**
01698      * @brief Determins if value is a yes or no (1 or 0).
01699      * @return bool Returns TRUE if yes or no, FALSE otherwise.
01700      * @param string $value The value to test.
01701      * @param bool $allowWord[optional] Allow words 'yes' and 'no' to be used as well.
01702      */
01703     public static function isYesNo($value, $allowWord = false) {
01704         $value = strtolower(trim($value));
01705         
01706         $result = array_key_exists($value, self::$yesNo);
01707         
01708         if ($allowWord) {
01709             $result = $result || self::isYesNoWord($value);
01710         }
01711         
01712         return $result;
01713     }
01714     
01715     /**
01716      * @brief Determins if value is a yes or no word.
01717      * @return bool Returns TRUE if value is 'yes' or 'no' (case insensitive), FALSE otherwise.
01718      * @param string $value The value to test.
01719      */
01720     public static function isYesNoWord($value) {
01721         $value = strtolower(trim($value));
01722         
01723         $tmpYesNo = array_change_value_case(self::$yesNo, CASE_LOWER);
01724         
01725         return in_array($value, $tmpYesNo);
01726     }
01727     
01728     /**
01729      * @brief Determins if value is true or false (1 or 0).
01730      * @return bool Returns TRUE if true or false, FALSE otherwise.
01731      * @param string $value The value to test.
01732      * @param bool $allowWord[optional] Allow words 'true' and 'false' to be used as well.
01733      */
01734     public static function isTrueFalse($value, $allowWord = false) {
01735         $value = strtolower(trim($value));
01736         
01737         $result = array_key_exists($value, self::$trueFalse);
01738         
01739         if ($allowWord) {
01740             $result = $result || self::isTrueFalseWord($value);
01741         }
01742         
01743         return $result;
01744     }
01745     
01746     /**
01747      * @brief Determins if value is a true or false word.
01748      * @return bool Returns TRUE if value is a 'true' or 'false' (case insensitive), FALSE otherwise.
01749      * @param string $value The value to test.
01750      */
01751     public static function isTrueFalseWord($value) {
01752         $value = strtolower(trim($value));
01753         
01754         $tmpTrueFalse = array_change_value_case(self::$trueFalse, CASE_LOWER);
01755         
01756         return in_array($value, $tmpTrueFalse);
01757     }
